snippet: After water poured into the cellars of WineCare Storage during Hurricane Sandy, most of its clients have been unable to get anywhere near their rare and valuable bottles.
abstract: Clients of WineCare Storage on West 28th Street in Manhattan have been unable to get anywhere near their rare and valuable bottles following severe flooding of facility during Hurricane Sandy; Judge Robert E Gerber of United States Bankruptcy Court will hold hearing on whether to liquidate the now-bankrupt business, opening door to resolving mystery of what happened to stored bottles and why customers have been kept at bay.
lead_paragraph: After water poured into the cellars of WineCare Storage during Hurricane Sandy, most of its clients have been unable to get anywhere near their rare and valuable bottles.

headline.main: Bankruptcy Court Hearing Examines Mystery at Wine Storage Business
headline.print_headline: Bankruptcy Hearing May Help Solve Mystery at Wine Storage Business
